                    Past, Present, Future                       We welcomed the dawn of a new age on July 1, 2008 when we officially became affiliated with New York University under the name Polytechnic Institute of NYU.      An alliance between Polytechnic, the nation’s second oldest private engineering school, and NYU, the largest private university in the United States, will result in broader, more valuable opportunities for students of New York and the nation, and will allow each of our institutions to more successfully meet the challenges of the 21st century.      As we embark on this next phase of our 150-plus-year-old evolution, we are inspired by the people and achievements of our rich history, are committed to reaching the academic and research goals of our vibrant present, and have our sights set on our promising future. Present, Future Giving                                          Home / About / Past, Present, Future                         About the School of Engineering                                                             Vibrant Present                       This is our Vision Statement in Practice. It’s a collection of concrete examples of how the NYU Polytechnic School of Engineering Vision Statement (the driving force behind the curriculum decisions we make, the large-scale projects we undertake, the partnerships we forge) is more than just words. Explore how our student, faculty, and Institute activities make us who we are.   We educate, discover, and invent.      Over 80 BS, MS, PhD and certificate programs    Undergraduate Summer Research program    Annual Inno/Vention student idea competition     We engage students seeking education achievement and opportunity, faculty seeking excellence and relevance, and organizations seeking solutions and talent.      Cyber Security Awareness Week (CSAW)    Varick Street, NYC ACRE and DUMBO business incubators    Career Fairs     We creatively bring intellectual rigor, technological innovation, and a passion for science to the communities where we work and live and to the citizens of the world.      Center for K12 STEM Education     We innovatively extend the benefits of science, engineering, management and liberal studies to critical real-world opportunities and challenges, especially those linked to urban systems, health and wellness, and the global information economy.      i 2 e (invention, innovation, and entrepreneurship)    Research centers     Our Vision Statement and the activities we engage in to execute it have their origins in the NYU Polytechnic School of Engineering Strategic Plan (PDF) , the roadmap to our future.
